What is the Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP)?

The Carbon Disclosure Project, known in short as the CDP, is a non-profit agency whose mission is to drive more sustainable economies. It does so by inspiring investors, companies, and cities to address their environmental impact by taking urgent action. Specifically, the organization facilitates a global disclosure system that helps participants measure and manage their day-to-day functions in a more sustainable manner.

This shift in strategy can be traced back to the early 2000s when the company carried out a global water initiative. Since then, it saved an estimated 10.4 billion gallons of water by reducing its usage by 62.5 percent, and it plans to keep this trajectory going to achieve three-fourths reduction ratings by 2020.
